description: To create Khee II, Jack Whitten placed a variety of flat objects beneath the canvas. After preparing the surface with gesso, he layered it with thin sheets of colored Japanese rice paper. As the rice paper dissolved, it left behind pure pigment. Whitten then pulled a rake or other notched tool across the surface. The results of this chance-based process are ghostlike images and alternating rows of color that vibrate with subtle luminosity.
title: Khee II
